movies.title: The Twin
movies.plot: Matthias Duval is in love, but he can't choose between the two twin sisters Betty and Liz Kerner. To pick up the two sisters, he invents his own twin brother and will play both characters.
movies.simplePlot: Matthias Duval is in love, but he can't choose between the two twin sisters Betty and Liz Kerner. To pick up the two sisters, he invents his own twin brother and will play both characters.

biography.bio: Certainly one of France's supreme farceurs in the classic tradition, comedian Pierre Richard was born to an uppercrust family with an embarrassing riches of middle names as he was christened Pierre Richard Maurice Charles Leopold Defays. Working and building up his trade at the Paris Music Hall in the early years, he appeared in small movie roles thoughout most of the 60s. In the 70s, however, he aimed his genius directly towards film and succeeded beyond the wildest expectations. Directing and co-writing many of his slapstick vehicles, his characters often have taken on an hilariously guileless persona and, coupled with his innate gift for klutzy physical comedy, have become an audience favorite for nearly four decades. His superior work in The Daydreamer (1970) and The Troubles of Alfred (1972) was immediately recognized and this led to the international crossover hit The Tall Blond Man with One Black Shoe (1973) in which Richard played a naive, innocent concert musician plucked by chance to become a superspy on a top secret mission. A potent association in the 1960s and 1970s with actor/producer/director Yves Robert and the 1980s with writer/director Francis Veber and actor Gerard Depardieu produced several comedy classics: Alexander (1967), The Return of the Tall Blond Man with One Black Shoe (1974), The Goat (1981), Les Comperes (1983) and The Fugitives (1986). Many of Richard's classic comedies, including The Toy (1976), have spawned Hollywood remakes and imitations, though most pale compared to the originals.
biography.name: Pierre Richard

biography.bio: Jean-Pierre Kalfon was born on October 30, 1938 in Paris, France. He is an actor and composer, known for Weekend (1967), Confidentially Yours (1983) and Saint-Cyr (2000).
biography.name: Jean-Pierre Kalfon

biography.bio: Camilla More was born on October 15, 1957 in London, England. She is an actress and producer, known for Friday the 13th: The Final Chapter (1984), The Twin (1984) and The Dark Side of the Moon (1990).
biography.name: Camilla More

biography.bio: Carey More was born on October 15, 1957 in London, England. She is known for her work on Friday the 13th: The Final Chapter (1984), Once Bitten (1985) and The Twin (1984).
biography.name: Carey More

biography.bio: Jacques Frantz was born on April 4, 1947 in Dijon, Côte-d'Or, France. He is an actor, known for G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra (2009), Heartbreaker (2010) and Astérix et les Vikings (2006).
biography.name: Jacques Frantz

biography.bio: Françoise Dorner was born on June 17, 1949 in Paris, France. She is an actress and writer, known for Les enfants des autres (1974), Madame et ses flics (1985) and The Twin (1984).
biography.name: Françoise Dorner

biography.bio: Jean-Pierre Castaldi was born on October 1, 1944 in Grenoble, Isère, France. He is an actor, known for Moonraker (1979), French Connection II (1975) and Asterix and Obelix vs. Caesar (1999).
biography.name: Jean-Pierre Castaldi

biography.bio: Paul Le Person was born on February 10, 1931 in Argenteuil, Val-d'Oise, France. He was an actor, known for A Man and a Woman (1966), The Tall Blond Man with One Black Shoe (1972) and Bernie (1996). He died on August 8, 2005 in Paris, France.
biography.name: Paul Le Person

biography.bio: Isabelle Strawa is an actress, known for The Twin (1984), Emmanuelle 5 (1987) and The Secrets of Love: Three Rakish Tales (1986).
biography.name: Isabelle Strawa

biography.bio: Jean-Claude Bouillaud was born on June 7, 1927 in Le Havre, Seine-Maritime, France. He was an actor, known for Un Coeur en Hiver (1992), Madame Bovary (1991) and The Professional (1981). He died on June 20, 2008 in Angers, Maine-et-Loire, France.
biography.name: Jean-Claude Bouillaud

biography.bio: Henri Labussière was born on March 20, 1921 in Villeneuve-Saint-Georges, Val-de-Marne, France. He was an actor and writer, known for Les aventures de Tintin (1991), The Twelve Tasks of Asterix (1976) and Astérix et le coup du menhir (1989). He died on June 15, 2008 in Paris, France.
biography.name: Henri Labussière

biography.bio: Paul Claudon was born on September 5, 1919 in Pont-à-Mousson, Meurthe-et-Moselle, France. He was a producer and actor, known for Going Places (1974), Get Out Your Handkerchiefs (1978) and Yoyo (1965). He died on July 5, 2002.
biography.name: Paul Claudon

biography.bio: Gérald Calderon was born on December 29, 1926 in Paris, France. He was a director and writer, known for Le risque de vivre (1978), Origins of Life (2001) and Attaville, la véritable histoire des fourmis (1998). He died on November 2, 2014 in Paris.
biography.name: Gérald Calderon

biography.bio: Alain Huylebroeck is known for his work on The Fugitives (1986), Under the Sun of Satan (1987) and Mélo (1986).
biography.name: Alain Huylebroeck

biography.bio: Andréa Ferréol was born on January 6, 1947 in Aix-en-Provence, France. She is an actress, known for Le dernier métro (1980), A Zed & Two Noughts (1985) and The Tin Drum (1979).
biography.name: Andréa Ferréol
